page.title: 17PORTHMADOG TRANSPORT
page.content: Public transport in the area is by train and bus.There are 2 railway lines operated by{British Rail}and the {Festiniog Railway Co}each with its own station.The latter was opened in 1836 to transport slates from Blaenau Ffestiniog to Porthmadog harbour.It closed in 1946 but was rebuilt by enthusiasts and reopened in 1955.It is now a major tourist attraction.The (BR) Cambrian Coast Line links Porthmadog with Pwllheli & Shrewsbury.The{Crosville Bus Co.}links Porthmadog with the surrounding towns & villages.The Traws-Cambria bus starting from Bangor provides a daily link with Cardiff.Most goods deliveries to the local shops are by lorry or van.Cars are used extensively for personal transport.The harbour is busy in the summer with small pleasure craft.
